com.opatomic

Class OpaStreamClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opatomic.OpaStreamClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OpaClient<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError>

    public class OpaStreamClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements OpaClient<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError>
    Opatomic client that uses 2 threads: 1 for parser and 1 for serializer. Methods do not block. Cannot modify args until callback is invoked (because requests are serialized in separate thread).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OpaStreamClient(java.io.InputStream in, java.io.OutputStream out)
      Create a new client that will serialize requests to an OutputStream and parse responses from an InputStream.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Run specified command on server.
      void callA(java.lang.String cmd, java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object> args, CallbackSF<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError> cb)
      Run specified command on server with an auto-generated asynchronous id.
      java.lang.Object callAP(java.lang.String cmd, java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object> args, CallbackSF<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError> cb)
      Run specified command on server with an auto-generated asynchronous id.
      void quit(java.lang.String cmd, java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object> args, CallbackSF<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError> cb)
      Queue a command that will: 1) close the send thread after the command has been written; no more commands will be sent 2) close the recv thread after the command's response has been parsed and the callback has been invoked
      boolean unregister(java.lang.Object id)
      Remove the callback for a callAP() invocation.

    • Method Detail

      • call

        public void call(java.lang.String cmd,
                 java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object> args,
                 CallbackSF<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError> cb)
        Description copied from interface: OpaClient
        Run specified command on server.
        Specified by:
        call in interface OpaClient<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError>
        Parameters:
        cmd - Command to run
        args - Command's parameters. Do not modify
        cb - Callback to invoke when response is received. If null then server will not send a response

      • callA

        public void callA(java.lang.String cmd,
                  java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object> args,
                  CallbackSF<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError> cb)
        Description copied from interface: OpaClient
        Run specified command on server with an auto-generated asynchronous id. Specified callback is invoked once, when response received. Response can arrive out of order. Command must respond only 1 time... do not use this for SUBSCRIBE (use callAP() instead).
        Specified by:
        callA in interface OpaClient<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError>
        Parameters:
        cmd - Command to run
        args - Command's parameters. Do not modify
        cb - Callback to invoke when response is received. Cannot be null.

      • callAP

        public java.lang.Object callAP(java.lang.String cmd,
                               java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object> args,
                               CallbackSF<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError> cb)
        Description copied from interface: OpaClient
        Run specified command on server with an auto-generated asynchronous id. Specified callback is invoked every time a response is received. Command can respond any number of times. Use this for SUBSCRIBE.
        Specified by:
        callAP in interface OpaClient<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError>
        Parameters:
        cmd - Command to run
        args - Command's parameters. Do not modify
        cb - Callback to invoke when responses are received. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        An id that can be used to unregister() when done listening for responses to the command

      • unregister

        public boolean unregister(java.lang.Object id)
        Description copied from interface: OpaClient
        Remove the callback for a callAP() invocation. Must call this when response from UNSUBSCRIBE is received. Otherwise you will have a memory leak.
        Specified by:
        unregister in interface OpaClient<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError>
        Parameters:
        id - The id returned from callAP()
        Returns:
        true if async callback id was found and removed; false if id was not found

      • quit

        public void quit(java.lang.String cmd,
                 java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object> args,
                 CallbackSF<java.lang.Object,OpaRpcError> cb)
        Queue a command that will: 1) close the send thread after the command has been written; no more commands will be sent 2) close the recv thread after the command's response has been parsed and the callback has been invoked
        Parameters:
        cmd - Command to run (ie, QUIT)
        args - Command's parameters. Do not modify
        cb - Callback to invoke when response is received
